summary: influenza B virus was detected using a respiratory virus panel of assays. the complete influenza B hemagglutinin gene was amplified and sequenced directly from clinical specimens. 71 hospitalized pediatric patients were influenza B positive. influenza B viruses evolve mainly through genetic reassortment between strains of different lineages. this allows for escape from host immunity and preservation of the ability to cause disease. despite the lineage, influenza B infection can cause severe disease and death. the study was approved by the Institutional Review Board of
